image.altText: Brittany Higgins walks with her partner.

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee tells Sky News to hand over an alleged recording between lawyer Leon Zwier and David Sharaz that purportedly took place during Brittany Higgins's testimony.

title.children: Sky News told to produce alleged secret recording of conversation between Brittany Higgins's lawyer and fiance

image.altText: A child's tiny malnourished hand, with a catheter on his wrist, grips his mother's thumb as she holds him up

props.synopsis: Pakistan is enduring the human effects of climate change with almost half of the country's children experiencing stunted growth a year on from devastating floods.

title.children: A year after a natural disaster struck Pakistan, something strange is happening to children's bodies

image.altText: Mark Dreyfus, Clare O'Neil and Andrew Giles press conference.

props.synopsis: The government has assembled a board of officials to manage the detainees released by the High Court's decision ruling indefinite detention to be illegal.

title.children: Government assembles board to manage detainees released by High Court decision

image.altText: The sun sets over Kakadu National Park.

props.synopsis: The High Court will this week hear the final appeal from custodians who want to prosecute the Commonwealth over illegal construction work at a sacred site within Kakadu National Park. What can be expected over the next two days?

title.children: From Kakadu to Australia's High Court: Custodians' final appeal over impact to sacred site

image.altText: Nuns

props.synopsis: Eight months after their $50 million class action settlement was finalised with the Commonwealth, descendants of the Northern Territory's Stolen Generations are still waiting to receive compensation.

title.children: A Stolen Generations class action settled eight months ago. Descendants are yet to see a cent

image.altText: Aerial image of firefighters standing out the front of house of Grose Vale, north of Sydney

props.synopsis: The 51-year-old on-call firefighter was among the first crews responding to the Grose Vale house, which became engulfed in flames, just before 8am.

title.children: Firefighter dies after being hit by falling beam during Airbnb house blaze north-west of Sydney

image.altText: A man in a blue suit and tie stands at a podium.

props.synopsis: Steven Miles will be the next premier of Queensland after Health Minister Shannon Fentiman withdrew her candidacy for the job.

title.children: Steven Miles to replace Annastacia Palaszczuk as Queensland premier, Cameron Dick to become deputy

image.altText: Kelly Ryan stands in a stadium.

props.synopsis: Kelly Ryan hands in her resignation effective immediately after a year of controversy and disharmony in the sport.

title.children: Netball boss Kelly Ryan resigns after months of disharmony over pay dispute

image.altText: satellite image of large tropical cyclone gettting closer to the north queensland coast

props.synopsis: The weather system weakened to a category one over the weekend but could redevelop into a category two as it moves towards the Queensland coast.

title.children: Damaging winds for parts of north Queensland expected today as Cyclone Jasper approaches

image.altText: Galiwinku after Cyclone Lam

props.synopsis: As Cyclone Jasper barrels towards far north Queensland coastal communities, social media has lit up with tips to prepare homes and businesses.

title.children: Windows, tape and safe rooms: What you need to know about cyclone preparation

image.altText: The Drum hosts Ellen Fanning and Julia Baird.

props.synopsis: The ABC announces panel discussion program The Drum will not return next year, with its final episode to air this Friday.

title.children: The Drum discontinued as ABC announces News Channel restructure

image.altText: A composite image of Sarah Snook in Succession, Margot Robbie as Barbie and Cillian Murphy in Oppenheimer.

props.synopsis: The nominees for the 2024 Golden Globe awards have been announced with Barbie and Succession both receiving multiple nominations.

title.children: Here are all the nominations for the Golden Globes — plus we unpack the biggest snubs and surprises

image.altText: a girl holding a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Of the influencers reviewed, the ACCC said 81 per cent were found to have posted something "that raised concerns" — one of the most identified issues being influencers not disclosing brand sponsorships or paid partnerships.

title.children: ACCC reviews more than 100 online influencers in social media crackdown

image.altText: The wing of a crumpled light plane can be seen in the distance

props.synopsis: Police say the crash at Lilydale north west of Grafton in northern NSW was reported around 9am.

title.children: Two dead in light plane crash in northern NSW

image.altText: To Muluwurri Magpies players embrace and celebrate.

props.synopsis: The rapid rise of Australian Rules Football continues on the Tiwi Islands, home to some of the sport's greatest names, as the inaugural grand final comes down to a thrilling finish.

title.children: 'Always been my dream': History made on Tiwi Islands after first women's footy grand final

image.altText: Professor Igor Koralnik assists a long COVID patient.

props.synopsis: Internationally, countries such as the US are scaling up efforts to address long COVID but Australia continues to close its specialist clinics. Medical professionals in Australia and overseas say it is a move that needs an urgent rethink.

title.children: Latest COVID wave will increase risk and severity of long COVID but clinics rapidly closing

image.altText: A sculpture surrounded by fog.

props.synopsis: About 30 flights in and out of Melbourne Airport have been cancelled due to heavy fog that has also made conditions on the roads treacherous.

title.children: Flights cancelled and speed limits reduced as thick fog falls over Melbourne

image.altText: Smoke rises from a block of crumbling buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: Israel's defence minister says his country has no intention of staying permanently in the Gaza Strip and it is open to discussing who will control the territory as long as it is not a group hostile to Israel.

title.children: Israel says it has 'no intention to stay permanently' in Gaza

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Cruise missile from Yemen strikes tanker ship
Israel to increase screening of aid trucks
Activists engage in civil disobedience in US Senate office building

image.altText: Joe Biden puts his arm around Zelenskyy on a previous visit

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president is meeting with his US counterpart as part of a last-minute push to convince American politicians to pass a bill to fund Kyiv's war effort.

title.children: Zelenskyy visits Washington, says funding for Ukraine critical to US security

image.altText: A young man with short brown hair in a check tshirt and jeans, sitting perched on a fence in a paddock.

props.synopsis: Eliott is one of 35 young people from regional Australia who have been named 2024 ABC Heywire winners for their resilience, courage and desire to create change. Here's where you can find their stories

title.children: Heywire winner tells of fear — then relief — when he came out as transgender in a small town

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are up slightly, as the Reserve Bank governor declares the central bank has not fallen behind other countries in keeping inflation under control. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA governor asks if Australians should pay a fee to use cash, ASX200 up slightly

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pay to use cash? Over my dead body
House prices to rise up to 6% next year: HSBC
Second worst year for consumer sentiment since 1974: Westpac

image.altText: Abattoir staff in white hard hats, grey overalls and blue aprons process meat hanging from the roof of a large room

props.synopsis: Analysts say the protracted bans were part of a campaign of economic punishment conducted by China against Australia due to political tensions.

title.children: China lifts restrictions on Australian abattoirs as trade tensions ease

image.altText: Ellie Carpenter has the ball between her legs with Lauren Hemp running behind her

props.synopsis: Over 5 million posts were analysed using a new AI-powered filtering tool, revealing one in five World Cup players received "discriminatory, abusive or threatening messaging".

title.children: 1 in 5 Women's World Cup players targeted by online abuse during tournament, report finds

image.altText: A whale toiling in shallow blue water

props.synopsis: An injured sperm whale that stranded itself at two Perth beaches in recent days dies after becoming stuck on a sand bar at Rockingham.

title.children: Stranded sperm whale dies after becoming stuck at sandbar at Perth beach

image.altText: An Indigenous climate activist from India holds a banner reading: End fossil fuel. Save our planet and our future.

props.synopsis: Leaders from countries in favour of a fossil fuel phase-out, including Australia's Pacific neighbours, are left stunned as the COP28 draft agreement omits any mention of the policy.

title.children: COP28 draft agreement omits plan to phase out fossil fuels, angering Pacific leaders

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: It is not surprising that a population surge that's contributing to higher rents and house prices has created heated political debate. Cutting net migration might help ease pressure, writes Nassim Khadem.

title.children: Do migrants push up house prices and compete for jobs, or pay economic dividends?

image.altText: A man in a suit with rolling green hills behind him

props.synopsis: Matthew Arnold was killed alongside colleague Rachel McCrow and local man Alan Dare one year ago today. His family says the date is a "day our family will never forget".

title.children: Matthew Arnold was killed one year ago today at Wieambilla. For his family, a 'bigger than life hole' remains in their hearts

image.altText: Caroline Gaultier

props.synopsis: We Chit Chat with Caroline Gaultier ahead of the Real Housewives of Sydney's season finale and reunion. (While she can't tell us exactly what happens, she can — and does — sum up the vibe.)

title.children: Real Housewives of Sydney's Caroline gives us reunion gossip ahead of S2's finale

image.altText: A bathtub full of brown water, with toys floating in it.

props.synopsis: Bathing in dirty, smelly water is nothing new in this town where residents spend thousands of dollars on bottled water to avoid drinking the "rotten" local supply.

title.children: Less than an hour from Canberra, 85pc of Yass residents won't drink their tap water

image.altText: An excavator on a mine with many people standing around.

props.synopsis: The bodies of eleven informal miners have been retrieved from an open-pit copper mine in Zambia where landslides buried them last month.

title.children: Death toll expected to rise at Zambia mine where more than 11 bodies recovered after landslides

image.altText: Construction workers in the Rozelle interchange tunnel

props.synopsis: Infrastructure Australia's annual market capacity report reveals there are only 177,000 workers currently in the system despite there being enough demand for the equivalent of 405,000 workers.

title.children: Massive workforce shortage threatens hundreds of billions of dollars in infrastructure investment

image.altText: Referee punched

props.synopsis: A referee in the top Turkish football league is punched and kicked after a match, as Greece puts a two month long ban on all supporters following fan violence.

title.children: Referee punched by club president in top-flight Turkish football match, as Greece bans fans for two months
